projects.name: Muralville
projects.description: Muralville, a murals finder app, is my love letter to the talented mural artists in Nashville. This app allows users to find, add, and keep track of their favorite murals around the city. Built with React using a flat-data structure in Firebase, I used the Leaflet API for the map component, along with ESRI and Bing Maps for GeoSearch and Autosuggest capabilities. I used Reactstrap to create the Modals and forms.
projects.technologies: React, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, SASS, Reactstrap, Leaflet

projects.name: Band Aid
projects.description: Band Aid was my full-stack capstone at NSS. It’s a networking platform to connect bands with musicians, allowing them to get in touch, set up practices, and coordinate shows.
projects.technologies: C#, ASP.NET Core, Dapper, React, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, SASS, Reactstrap

projects.name: Magic E8 Ball
projects.description: Magic E8 Ball is a recruiting tool for hiring managers who are looking for junior developers. This project grew out of my desire to get more experience with React and to explore making shapes with raw CSS.

projects.name: Skull & Daisy
projects.description: Skull & Daisy—a group project at NSS—is a storefront webapp. My duties involved acting as Scrum Master, providing the Users and PaymentType models and API controllers using repository design pattern. On the front end, I wrote authentication procedures using Firebase, implemented a seller dashboard to display sales history, and provided inventory management methods.
projects.technologies: C#, ASP.NET Core, Dapper, React, Axios, Firebase, JavaScript, SASS, Reactstrap

projects.name: The Runs
projects.description: My take on a personal runs tracking tool. I wanted to track my own runs without the pop-ups and social media aspects of Strava.
projects.technologies: C#, ASP.NET Core, MongoDB, React, Reactstap
